page.title: 12Farming Activities
page.content: steadings are empty and falling into dilapidation, but the policy of the owners has been not to sell to parties interested in restoring them. The names of these farms and their past history are locally well known and accepted landmarks of the Blackford community. Rabbits are the biggest pest on the land and the few gamekeepers cannot keep them under control. Flocks of migrating geese in large numbers are part of the colourful Autumn scene at Blackford as they fly in vast formations high above the village with their haunting cry and often be seen descending into the fields to eat their fill of grasses and seed.
